Detailed Description

The abstract superclass of classes which define Engage library UI configuration customizations.

Extend this class and implement a public default constructor. In that constructor assign values to the fields you wish to use in your custom UI configuration.

This class also supplies event hooks to further control the look and feel of the Engage library.

Member Function Documentation

void onProviderListViewCreate ( ListView  providerListView)

Called when the ListView for the provider list is created, but before the Adapter is set on it. You can use this method to customize the ListView

Variables

String mProviderListTitle

A custom title for the provider list activity

String mLandingTitle

A custom title for the return experience and OpenID landing activity

String mWebViewTitle

A custom title for the WebView activity

String mSharingTitle

A custom title for the sharing activity

Boolean mShowProviderListTitleWhenDialog

Controls the display of the provider list title/ActionBar when running in dialog mode on a tablet

Boolean mShowLandingTitleWhenDialog

Controls the display of the return experience / OpenID landing page title/ActionBar when running in dialog mode on a tablet

Boolean mShowWebViewTitleWhenDialog

Controls the display of the WebView title/ActionBar when running in dialog mode on a tablet

Boolean mShowSharingTitleWhenDialog

Controls the display of the sharing title/ActionBar when running in dialog mode on a tablet

JRCustomInterfaceView mProviderListHeader

Provides a custom ListView header for the provider list. This can be used to implement your own username/password sign-in

String mProviderListSectionHeader

Provides a custom section header displayed below the provider list header and above the list of providers.

String mProviderListSectionFooter

Provides a custom section footer displayed below the provider list and above the provider list footer.

JRCustomInterfaceView mProviderListFooter

Provides a custom ListView footer for the provider list.

Boolean mSharingUsesSystemTabs

Controls the use of the default system tabs displayed in the sharing UI

Boolean mColorButtons

Controls coloring of buttons displayed by the library
